protocol_name: Extraction of alarm substance in zebrafish
protocol_name_html: Extraction of alarm substance in zebrafish
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cnc6g","text":"Alarm substance, or Schrekcstoff, is an mixture of compounds produced by specialized club cells in the epidermis of Ostariophysan fish. When lesioned, these cells release the substance, which acts as an aversive olfactory stimulus capable of evoking intense behavioral responses (alarm reaction) in other fish in the shoal (Maximino et al. 2018). Alarm substance is used as an aversive stimulus to study fear-like behavior in Ostariophysan - especially in zebrafish. The present protocol describes a technique to easily extract alarm substance for acute exposure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":20,"length":12,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

materials.reagent_name: 15 ml sterile falcon tubes and rack
Cotton Gauze Swabs (10 x 10cm x 8 ply)

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"5n5q8","text":"1. Alarm substance extraction begins by cutting the fish skin with a scalpel; therefore, care must be taken to avoid accidents","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bdj28","text":"2. All manipulations must be made using surgical gloves, to reduce the risk of contamination by aquatic bacteria (e.g., Mycobacterium marinum)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

affiliation: Universidade Federal do Sul e Sudeste do Pará

keywords: Zebrafish, Alarm substance, Fear, Club cells
authors: Rhayra Xavier do Carmo Silva,Sueslene Prado Rocha,Monica Gomes Lima-Maximino,Caio Maximino

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"9kcsf","text":"Guidelines for humane euthanasia must be followed, and animals should NEVER be euthanized without deep anesthesia. See Matthews & Varga (doi: 10.1093/ilar.53.2.192) for a review.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":142,"length":21,"key":0}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/ilar.53.2.192"}}}}
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"ai8ko","text":"Separate a donor fish from the home tank and transport to the experiment area","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7jnj8","text":"Slowly add ice chips to the beaker to bring the temperature down to  . The animal is considered anesthetized when it no longer reacts to gentle manipulation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"offset":68,"length":1,"key":0}],"data":[]},{"key":"1kcv4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"88n5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"id":0,"guid":"DBF11C90BCE311E8856A4FED5020CA68","temperature":"12","unit":10,"label":"","step_guid":"7D9D0280BCE311E8856A4FED5020CA68"}}],"guid":"7D9D0280BCE311E8856A4FED5020CA68","id":666135,"previous_guid":"7D9CDB70BCE311E8856A4FED5020CA68","section":"Anesthesia"}
